Title: 2023 Nobel Prize Concert
Description:
This year’s Nobel Prize Concert brings together world-renowned conductor Esa-Pekka Salonen and acclaimed violinist Julia Fischer, together with the Royal Stockholm Philharmonic Orchestra. On 8 December, works by Boccherini, Brahms and Ravel were performed on the Konserthuset Stockholm stage. The audience also heard a work by the exciting young composer Gabriella Smith.

In Sweden you can watch the concert on SVT Play. https://www.svtplay.se/nobelkonserten

Title: Alexander Skrjabin: "Le poème de l’extase" | Esa-Pekka Salonen | NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchester
Description:
Das NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchester spielt unter der Leitung von Esa-Pekka Salonen Alexander Skrjabins großbesetztes Orchesterwerk "Poème de l’extase" aus dem Jahr 1908. Das Werk gipfelt in einem wahren Orchesterrausch - und wurde von manchem Zeitgenossen als "obszön" empfunden. 

Ein Ausschnitt aus dem Konzert im Rahmen des Internationalen Musikfests Hamburg am 12. Mai 2023. Die Aufnahme steht bis zum 11. Mai 2028 zur Verfügung.
 
ALEXANDER SKRJABIN
Le poème de l’extase op. 54

Esa-Pekka Salonen, Dirigent
NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchester

Title: Esa-Pekka Salonen conducts Debussy, Ligeti, and Messiaen (Philharmonie de Paris, 14-9-2022)
Description:
A remarkable concert with the Orchestre de Paris under the direction of Esa-Pekka Salonen, held at the Philharmonie de Paris on 14 September 2022.
This is the full, UNCUT version from Philharmonie Live. Please take note of the video timestamps below.
Un concert remarquable avec l'Orchestre de Paris sous la direction d'Esa-Pekka Salonen, donné à la Philharmonie de Paris le 14 septembre 2022.
Il s'agit de la version complète non coupée de Philharmonie Live. Veuillez prendre note des horodatages des vidéos ci-dessous.

Arte:
L’expression sanscrite « turangalîla » signifie « chanson d'amour, hymne de joie, mouvement, rythme, vie et mort ». En composant ce poème symphonique, l'ambition d'Olivier Messiaen est donc claire : il cherche à illustrer en musique l’amour, la passion et le divin. Pour atteindre cet objectif, le compositeur avignonnais s’inspire de la célèbre légende de Tristan et Iseut, le couple maudit lui permettant de décliner toutes les nuances du sentiment amoureux.

En introduction à la Turangalîla-Symphonie, l’Orchestre de Paris interprète deux œuvres qui lui permettent de déployer toutes les couleurs de son répertoire : la symboliste et mystique Damoiselle élue de Claude Debussy et l’aussi complexe que poétique Clocks and Clouds de György Ligeti.

Pour sublimer ces trois partitions, Esa-Pekka Salonen s’entoure de musiciens d’exception : la soprano Axelle Fanyo, les mezzo-sopranos Fleur Barron et Marie-Andrée Bouchard-Lesieur, le pianiste Bertrand Chamayou et l’instrumentiste Nathalie Forget aux Ondes Martenot. A ces solistes s’ajoutent pas moins de trois cœurs (le Chœur de l'Orchestre de Paris, le Chœur de jeunes de l’Orchestre de Paris et accentus) dirigés par Marc Korovitch.

0:00:00 - Prélude

Part I
Achille Claude Debussy (22 August 1862 – 25 March 1918)

0:11:04 - La damoiselle élue, L. 62 (1887-1888)
Cantate pour soprano, chœurs, et orchestre

Axelle Fanyo, soprano
Fleur Barron & Marie-Andrée Bouchard-Lesieur, mezzo-soprani
Chœur de l'Orchestre de Paris
Chœur de jeunes de l’Orchestre de Paris

[Intermission]

Part II
György Sándor Ligeti (28 May 1923 – 12 June 2006)

0:42:59 - Clocks and Clouds (1972-1973)
Für 12-stimmigen Frauenchor und Orchester

[Intermission]

Part III
Olivier Eugène Prosper Charles Messiaen (10 December 1908 — 27 April 1992)

Turangalîla, I/29 (1946-1948)
Symphonie pour piano principal, ondes Martenot, et grand orchestre

Bertrand Chamayou, piano
Nathalie Forget, ondes Martenot

1:24:09 - I. Introduction. Modéré, un peu vif
1:30:41 - II. Chant d’amour I. Modéré, lourd
1:39:13 - III. Turangalîla I. Presque lent, rêveur
1:44:38 - IV. Chant d’amour II. Bien modéré
1:55:14 - V. Joie du sang des étoiles. Vif, passionné avec joie
2:02:29 - VI. Jardin du sommeil d’amour. Très modéré, très tendre
2:13:50 - VII. Turangalîla II. Un peu vif, bien modéré
2:17:47 - VIII. Développement d’amour. Bien modéré
2:29:52 - IX. Turangalîla III. Bien modéré
2:33:54 - X. Final. Modéré, presque vif, avec une grande joie

Selon la description de cette chaîne, je ne possède rien dans cette vidéo. La musique et les performances ont été téléchargées à des fins de divulgation uniquement.
As per the description of this channel, I do not own anything within this video. The music and performances have been uploaded for divulgation purposes only.

Réalisation d'Isabelle Julien
CAMERA LUCIDA PRODUCTIONS
Paris, France, 2022

Title: NSO: Salonen, Mahler & Stravinsky
Description:
Joana Carneiro, conductor
Tara Erraught, mezzo-soprano
Presented by Paul Herriott, RTÉ lyric fm

Salonen Helix
Mahler Lieder eines fahrenden Gesellen
Stravinsky Petrushka (1947 version)

Going in search of the great perhaps… a thrilling contemporary work accelerating into excelsis, a masterpiece song cycle in which a rejected lover seeks solace in nature, and a tale of three puppets entangled in an unlikely ménage à trois.

Making her debut with the National Symphony Orchestra, fast-rising star Joana Carneiro, a ‘refined and exciting… conductor who makes us listen’ (Mercury News), is joined by the ‘magnetic stage presence’ (Opera Traveller) and ever-welcome mezzo-soprano Tara Erraught.

Essa-Pekka Salonen’s Helix is an exercise in conjuring and stamina: two intertwined repeating phrases wrapping ever-tighter around each other even as they constantly accelerate to the point where something has to give!

Prompted by unrequited love, Mahler’s first song cycle, the poetic and poignant Lieder eines fahrenden Gesellen(Songs of a Wayfarer) goes to the aching romantic heart of a young would-be lover’s pained first disappointment. Mahler’s own lyrics underline his own forlorn autobiography, his sylvan and svelte music finding consolation and comfort in the natural world.

Petrushka fuses two great Russian traditions – folk music and puppetry – into a ‘ballet burlesque’ in which puppets, newly come to life, become embroiled in a quarrel for the affections of a beautiful ballerina. Stravinsky’s brightly colourful music is one of the richest and most brilliantly animated scores of the early 20th century.

Finnish Radio Symphony Orchestra
Direction: Hannu Lintu,

NYX (Composition)
The piece is titled after the Goddess Nyx from Greek mythology. Salonen wrote of this inspiration:
Nyx is a symphonic poem by the Finnish composer Esa-Pekka Salonen. The work was jointly commissioned by Radio France, the Barbican Centre, the Atlanta Symphony Orchestra, Carnegie Hall, and the Finnish Broadcasting Company. It was premiered February 19, 2011 in the Théâtre du Châtelet, Paris, with Salonen conducting the Orchestre Philharmonique de Radio France. The piece is titled after the Goddess Nyx from Greek mythology.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyx_%28...

NYX in Mythology
Nyx is a shadowy figure in Greek mythology. At the very beginning of everything there's a big mass of dark stuff called Chaos, out of which comes Gaia or Ge, the Earth, who gives birth (spontaneously!) to Uranus, the starry heaven, and Pontus, the sea. Nyx (also sometimes known as Nox) is supposed to have been another child of Gaia, along with Erebus. The union of Nyx and Erebus produces Day.

Official Site: http://www.esapekkasalonen.com/index.php

Artwork by Zdzislaw Beksinski
Virtual Museum: http://www.dmochowskigallery.net/

Title: Sibelius Symphony No 7 C Major Esa Pekka Salonen Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra
Description:
Jean Sibelius 
Symphony No 7 C major, 1924 
Esa-Pekka Salonen conducts Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra
The symphony is in one movement, with the following structure :
1 Adagio (bb. 1-92)
2 Un pochett. meno adagio -- poco affrett. -- Poco a poco affrettando il Tempo al ... Vivacissimo -- rallentando al ... (bb. 93-221)
3 Adagio -- Poco a poco meno lento al ... (bb. 222-257)
4 Allegro molto moderato -- Un pochett. affretando (bb. 258-285)
5 Allegro moderato -- Poco a poco meno moderato (bb. 286-408)
6 Vivace (bb. 409-448)
7 Presto -- Poco a poco rallentando al ... (bb. 449-475)
8 Adagio (bb. 476-495)
9 Largamente molto -- Affettuoso (bb. 496-521)
10 Tempo I (bb. 522-525)

Title: Tamara Stefanovich plays Magnus Lindberg: Piano Concerto No. 3 | Live in Hamburg
Description:
Friday, 5 & Sunday, 7 May 2023
HAMBURG
ELBPHILHARMONIE GROSSER SAAL
NDR ELBPHILHARMONIE ORCHESTRA
TAMARA STEFANOVICH, piano
ESA-PEKKA SALONEN, conductor

PROGRAM:
Magnus Lindberg
Concerto for Piano and Orchestra No. 3 | 02:37

Encore:

György Kurtág
Pantomime / Zanken 2 / Játékok | 40:40

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
Interview with Tamara Stefanovich and Esa-Pekka Salonen | 42:34


Due to illness, Yuja Wang unfortunately had to cancel her participation in this concert. Thankfully Tamara Stefanovich has agreed at short notice to take over in her place. The Finnish conductor and composer Esa-Pekka Salonen has been a very regular visitor to the Elbphilharmonie since last season. As part of the two-year »Multiverse« series focused on his multi-faceted artistry, he now returns for two more concert projects in quick succession with the NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchestra. In the first programme he is joined by the great pianist Tamara Stefanovich. Together, they present a new work by Salonen’s friend and compatriot Magnus Lindberg. The Finnish composer known for his sonorous works has written a new piano concerto as a commissioned work for NDR. With this kind of dream team gathered, an unforgettable musical experience is guaranteed!
